metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38560 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: An integer overflow flaw was found in pcl/pl/plfont.c:418 in pl_glyph_name in ghostscript. This issue may allow a local attacker to cause a denial of service via transforming a crafted PCL file to PDF format.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> by default, PCL is not built in Ubuntu, this happens with the usage of the build option --without-pcl. most releases don't package pcl/ dir. PCL is not built or packed due to a build issue with system-shared libjpeg. more in https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=696654

criterions.comment: ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
